datafield.subfield: Brief history of APU page (Chelmer Institute of Higher Education became Essex Institute of Higher Education in 1984, in 1989 the Cambridgeshire College of Arts and Technology and the Essex Institute of Higher Education merged to become Anglia Higher Education College)
Anglia Ruskin University, heritage Web site, Feb. 8, 2008

(1909: Cambridge and County School of Arts, Crafts, and Technology was opened [no publs. in LC database]; 1935: Mid-Essex Technical College and School of Art was established [no publs. in LC database]; 1960: Cambridgeshire Technical College and School of Art [no publs. in LC database] became the Cambridgeshire College of Arts and Technology; 1976: Mid-Essex Technical College and Brentwood College of Education [no publs. in LC database] merged to form the Chelmer Institute of Higher Education; 1984: Chelmer Institute became the Essex Institute of Higher Education; 1989: Cambridgeshire College of Arts and Technology and the Essex Institute of Higher Education became statutory corporations and then merged to become Anglia Higher Education College (AHEC); 1991: AHEC was granted Polytechnic status becoming Anglia Polytechnic; 1992: Privy Council awarded University status thus forming Anglia Polytechnic University; 2005: Privy Council approves name change to Anglia Ruskin University)
